subject: Art & Design
title: The Endowment Effect: Ownership Changes Value
description: A fast breakdown of The Endowment Effect: Ownership Changes Value for builders.

hook.text: Give someone a coffee mug. Ask them to sell it. They price it double what buyers would pay. Owning it changed its value.

buildup.text: The endowment effect: people value things more once they own (or feel they own) them.

discovery.text: Free trials exploit this. Once you've used a product for 30 days, canceling feels like losing something you have.

twist.text: Customization deepens endowment. Build-a-Bear, Nike iD, and avatar creation make products feel personally 'yours.'

climax.text: Spotify's personalized playlists, Duolingo's streak count ‚Äî these create psychological ownership that's hard to abandon.

punchline.text: You don't value what you choose. You value what feels like yours.

quiz.question: How do free trials exploit the endowment effect?
options: After using a product, canceling feels like losing something you already own
Free trials are always high quality
Users forget to cancel, not because of psychology
